alert.note: Alert for Callahan; Shackelford; Taylor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 11:16PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Callahan, southeastern Shackelford and southeastern Taylor Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1115 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Moran to near Goldsboro. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts 45 to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clyde, Baird, Cross Plains, Lawn, Moran, Putnam, Atwell, Eula, Dudley, Rowden, Oplin, Admiral, Us-283 Near The Callahan- Shackelford County Line, I-20 Near The Callahan- Eastland County Line and Us-283 Near The Coleman- Callahan County Line. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 299 and 323. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.
